body:
Looking for a keyboard under $60 that has either red or blue switches. I don't care about the brand unless it's known for being unreliable. 

Happy hunting :]

replies.body:
The Redragon is not mechanical and honestly I doubt you're going to find a good mechanical keyboard under $60. These two are the closest to your budget that I would actually recommend: http://www.amazon.com/Razer-BlackWidow-Tournament-Essential-Mechanical/dp/B00IG3GPC0/ref=sr_1_3?s=el... and http://www.amazon.com/Mechanical-Keyboard-Noppoo-Lolita-Spyder/dp/B00T1P80XY/ref=sr_1_10?s=electroni...
If you can't afford either of those and have to go with membrane, I suggest http://www.frys.com/product/7940850 can't beat it for the price (It's on sale).
replies.body_tagged:
The Redragon is not mechanical and honestly I doubt you're going to find a good mechanical keyboard under $60. If you can't afford either of those and have to go with membrane, I suggest http://www.frys.com/product/7940850 can't beat it for the price (It's on sale).

replies.body:
Razer's Shit.
Well I shouldn't say that, they're OK but there are better options like corsair. But if you want a keyboard that's mechanical you're going to need to spend a bit more, unless you're fine with Kailth switches. But to be completely honest, if you don't have a decent mouse, get that first, it will help you FAR more than a new keyboard.
replies.body_tagged:
Razer's Shit.
Well I shouldn't say that, they're OK but there are better options like corsair. But if you want a keyboard that's mechanical you're going to need to spend a bit more, unless you're fine with Kailth switches. But to be completely honest, if you don't have a decent mouse, get that first, it will help you FAR more than a new keyboard.

replies.body:
My mouse is like 100 bucks and it's durable as well. This mouse isn't breaking. 

And I try to avoid Razer altogether. I would never buy a Razer product. I've been looking at keyboards on Corsair's website and I like a lot of what I see. I'd really like cherry mx blues or reds for a good price. I think I might bump up my budget to like 80 bucks instead.

replies.body: Logitech mechanical gaming keyboard. You can pick these up very cheap from 100-120 dollars. Don't go for a expensive one as they wear away faster and are a waste of money for something exactly the same as other copies.
